A11Y_INSTANTIATED_FLAG.description: Flag indicating accessibility support has been instantiated.

A11Y_CONSUMERS.description: A list of known accessibility clients that inject into Firefox process space (see https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/accessible/windows/msaa/Compatibility.h).

A11Y_ISIMPLEDOM_USAGE_FLAG.description: Flag indicating the ISimpleDOM* accessibility interfaces has been used.

A11Y_IATABLE_USAGE_FLAG.description: Flag indicating the IAccessibleTable accessibility interface has been used.

A11Y_UIA_DETECTION_TIMING_MS.description: The amount of time the parent process blocked while detecting a UIA client.

A11Y_TREE_UPDATE_TIMING_MS.description: The amount of time taken to update the accessibility tree (ms)

ABOUT_CONFIG_FEATURES_USAGE.description: Record number of times particular features on about:config are used

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_BINARY_TYPE.description: Whether or not the file examined by download protection is a binary type (or it's not possible to tell because the filename is missing).

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_BINARY_ARCHIVE.description: Whether a binary file examined by download protection is one of the common archive formats.

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_HASH_LENGTH.description: Whether the hash included in application reputation lookups is valid or broken in some way.

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_REASON.description: The reason application reputation service blocks or allows the download.

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_SHOULD_BLOCK.description: Overall (local or remote) application reputation verdict (shouldBlock=false is OK).

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_SERVER.description: Status of the application reputation remote lookup (0=OK, 1=failed, 2=invalid protobuf response)

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_SERVER_2.description: Network status of the application reputation remote lookup

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_SERVER_VERDICT_2.description: Application reputation remote verdict, keyed by file extension

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_REMOTE_LOOKUP_RES.description: Server response time to remote lookup request (ms).

APPLICATION_REPUTATION_REMOTE_LOOKUP_TIM.description: Recorded when application reputation remote lookup is performed, `true` is recorded if the lookup times out.

AUDIOSTREAM_BACKEND_USED.description: The operating system audio back-end used when successfully opening an audio stream, or whether the failure occurred on the first try or not <https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?q=AUDIOSTREAM_BACKEND_ID_STR>

BACKGROUNDFILESAVER_THREAD_COUNT.description: Maximum number of concurrent threads reached during a given download session

CHECKERBOARD_DURATION.description: Duration of a checkerboard event in milliseconds

CHECKERBOARD_PEAK.description: Peak number of CSS pixels checkerboarded during a checkerboard event (the high value is the size of a 4k display with max APZ zooming)

CHECKERBOARD_POTENTIAL_DURATION.description: Duration of a chunk of time (in ms) that could reasonably have had checkerboarding

CHECKERBOARD_SEVERITY.description: Opaque measure of the severity of a checkerboard event

CHILD_PROCESS_LAUNCH_MS.description: Time spent in the generic child process launching code, which is run off-main-thread and used by all child process types

COMPOSITE_SWAP_TIME.description: Time to do swap/present/commit in 100 microseconds

COMPOSITE_FRAME_ROUNDTRIP_TIME.description: Time from vsync to finishing a composite in milliseconds.

CONTENT_PROCESS_LAUNCH_MAINTHREAD_MS.description: Time spent on the main thread during asynchronous content process launch.

CONTENT_PROCESS_LAUNCH_TOTAL_MS.description: Total time elapsed during asynchronous content process launch, until the process is usable for loading content.

CONTENT_PROCESS_SYNC_LAUNCH_MS.description: Time elapsed during synchronous content process launch until the process is usable for loading content.

CONTENT_PROCESS_LAUNCH_IS_SYNC.description: Whether a content process was launched synchronously (unnecessarily delaying UI response).

CONTENT_RESPONSE_DURATION.description: Main thread response times for APZ notifications about input events (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR.description: Time spent on one cycle collection (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER.description: Time spent on one cycle collection in a worker (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_FULL.description: Full pause time for one cycle collection, including preparation (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_MAX_PAUSE.description: Longest pause for an individual slice of one cycle collection, including preparation (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_FINISH_IGC.description: Cycle collection finished an incremental GC

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_SYNC_SKIPPABLE.description: Cycle collection synchronously ran forget skippable

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_VISITED_REF_COUNTED.description: Number of ref counted objects visited by the cycle collector

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER_VISITED_REF_COUNT.description: Number of ref counted objects visited by the cycle collector in a worker

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_VISITED_GCED.description: Number of JS objects visited by the cycle collector

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER_VISITED_GCED.description: Number of JS objects visited by the cycle collector in a worker

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_COLLECTED.description: Number of objects collected by the cycle collector

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER_COLLECTED.description: Number of objects collected by the cycle collector in a worker

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_NEED_GC.description: Needed garbage collection before cycle collection.

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER_NEED_GC.description: Needed garbage collection before cycle collection in a worker.

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_TIME_BETWEEN.description: Time spent in between cycle collections (seconds)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_OOM.description: Set if the cycle collector ran out of memory at some point

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_WORKER_OOM.description: Set if the cycle collector in a worker ran out of memory at some point

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_ASYNC_SNOW_WHITE_FREEING.description: Time spent on one asynchronous SnowWhite freeing (ms)

CYCLE_COLLECTOR_SLICE_DURING_IDLE.description: Percent of cycle collector slice done during idle time

DEFERRED_FINALIZE_ASYNC.description: Pause time for asynchronous deferred finalization (ms)

DEVICE_RESET_REASON.description: GPU Device Reset Reason (ok, hung, removed, reset, internal error, invalid call, out of memory)

FORGET_SKIPPABLE_MAX.description: Max time spent on one forget skippable (ms)

FORGET_SKIPPABLE_DURING_IDLE.description: Percent of the cycle collector's forget skippable done during idle time

FORGET_SKIPPABLE_FREQUENCY.description: Number of forget skippables occurred during a minute

FULLSCREEN_TRANSITION_BLACK_MS.description: The time spent in the fully-black screen in fullscreen transition

FULLSCREEN_CHANGE_MS.description: The time content uses to enter/exit fullscreen regardless of fullscreen transition timeout

GC_REASON_2.description: Reason (enum value) for initiating a GC

GC_IN_PROGRESS_MS.description: Time from the beginning of the first slice to the end of the last slice (ms)

GC_ANIMATION_MS.description: Time spent running JS GC when animating (ms)

GC_MAX_PAUSE_MS_2.description: Longest GC slice in a GC (ms)

GC_MARK_MS.description: Time spent running JS GC mark phase (ms)

GC_SWEEP_MS.description: Time spent running JS GC sweep phase (ms)

GC_COMPACT_MS.description: Time spent running JS GC compact phase (ms)

GC_MARK_GRAY_MS.description: Time spent marking gray GC objects (ms)

GC_SLICE_MS.description: Time spent running a JS GC slice (ms)

GC_SLOW_PHASE.description: The longest phase in any slice that goes over 2x the budget. The phase values are defined in js/src/gc/GenerateStatsPhases.py.

GC_SLOW_TASK.description: The longest parallel task in any slice that goes over 2x the budget. The phase values are defined in js/src/gc/GenerateStatsPhases.py.

GC_MMU_50.description: Minimum percentage of time spent outside GC over any 50ms window

GC_RESET_REASON.description: Reason for cancelling an ongoing GC (see js::gc::AbortReason)

GC_NON_INCREMENTAL_REASON.description: Reason for performing a non-incremental GC (see js::gc::AbortReason)

GC_SCC_SWEEP_MAX_PAUSE_MS.description: Time spent sweeping slowest compartment SCC (ms)

GC_MINOR_REASON.description: Reason (enum value) for initiating a minor GC

GC_MINOR_REASON_LONG.description: Reason (enum value) that caused a long (>1ms) minor GC

GC_MINOR_US.description: Time spent running JS minor GC (us)

GC_PRETENURE_COUNT.description: How many objects groups were selected for pretenuring by a minor GC

GC_SLICE_DURING_IDLE.description: Percent of GC slice done during idle time

GC_BUDGET_OVERRUN.description: How long a GC slice ran over its budget in microseconds

GC_NURSERY_PROMOTION_RATE.description: The percentage of nursery objects that were promoted to tenured heap.

GC_TENURED_SURVIVAL_RATE.description: The percentage of tenured GC things that survived a collection.

GC_MARK_RATE.description: The number of objects marked per ms during GC.

GC_TIME_BETWEEN_S.description: Time spent in between garbage collections for the main runtime (seconds)

GC_TIME_BETWEEN_SLICES_MS.description: Time spent in between garbage collections slice for the main runtime (ms)

GC_SLICE_COUNT.description: The number of slices in an incremental GC for the main runtime

GC_EFFECTIVENESS.description: GC 'effectiveness', the amount of memory freed divided by main-thread collection time (MB/s)

GEOLOCATION_ACCURACY_EXPONENTIAL.description: Geolocation results' accuracy radius in meters. Smaller radius is more accurate.

GEOLOCATION_REQUEST_GRANTED.description: Geolocation requests either granted or denied (0=denied/other, 1=denied/http, 2=denied/https, ..., 10=granted/other, 11=granted/http, 12=granted/https)

GEOLOCATION_WIN8_SOURCE_IS_MLS.description: Geolocation on Win8 is either MLS or native

GEOLOCATION_OSX_SOURCE_IS_MLS.description: Geolocation on OS X is either MLS or CoreLocation

GEOLOCATION_GETCURRENTPOSITION_VISIBLE.description: This metric is recorded every time a navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition() request gets allowed/fulfilled. A false value is recorded if the owner is not visible according to document.isVisible.

GEOLOCATION_WATCHPOSITION_VISIBLE.description: This metric is recorded every time a navigator.geolocation.watchPosition() request gets allowed/fulfilled. A false value is recorded if the owner is not visible according to document.isVisible.

GPU_PROCESS_LAUNCH_TIME_MS_2.description: GPU process launch time in milliseconds

GPU_PROCESS_INITIALIZATION_TIME_MS.description: GPU process initialization (excluding XPCOM and fork time) time in milliseconds

GPU_PROCESS_CRASH_FALLBACKS.description: Count how often we use different fallbacks when the GPU process crashes: None=0, GPUProcessDecodingDisabled=1, GPUProcessDisabled=2

JS_PRIVILEGED_PARSER_COMPILE_LAZY_AFTER_.description: Time elapsed between the moment a function is lazy-parsed (end of parsing of the ScriptSource) and the moment it is recompiled as non-lazy (start of compilation), in milliseconds, for privileged code.

JS_WEB_PARSER_COMPILE_LAZY_AFTER_MS.description: Time elapsed between the moment a function is lazy-parsed (end of parsing of the ScriptSource) and the moment it is recompiled as non-lazy (start of compilation), in milliseconds, for web code.

MEMORY_DISTRIBUTION_AMONG_CONTENT.description: Absolute difference of each content process' USS and the mean of USS's, normalized by the mean, in percentage. It will be recorded with the rest of the memory probes when gatherMemory is called, if at least 2 content processes are alive. Example: in case of 4 content processes with USS's: 1G, 500MB, 1G, 1.5G, the reported numbers will be: 0, 50, 0, 50. Which indicates that 2 processes used 50% more or 50% less memory than the avarage and 2 used exactly as much as the avarage.

MEMORY_UNIQUE_CONTENT_STARTUP.description: Unique Set Size of Content Process at Startup (KB)

MEMORY_VSIZE_MAX_CONTIGUOUS.description: Maximum-sized block of contiguous virtual memory (KB)

MEMORY_JS_COMPARTMENTS_SYSTEM.description: Total JavaScript compartments used for add-ons and internals.

MEMORY_JS_COMPARTMENTS_USER.description: Total JavaScript compartments used for web pages

MEMORY_JS_REALMS_SYSTEM.description: Total JavaScript realms used for add-ons and internals.

MEMORY_JS_REALMS_USER.description: Total JavaScript realms used for web pages.

MEMORY_JS_GC_HEAP.description: Memory used by the garbage-collected JavaScript heap (KB)

MEMORY_IMAGES_CONTENT_USED_UNCOMPRESSED.description: Memory used for uncompressed, in-use content images (KB)

MEMORY_HEAP_OVERHEAD_FRACTION.description: Fraction of committed heap memory that is overhead (percentage).

MEMORY_FREE_PURGED_PAGES_MS.description: Time(ms) to purge dirty heap pages.

LOW_MEMORY_EVENTS_VIRTUAL.description: Number of low-virtual-memory events fired since last ping

LOW_MEMORY_EVENTS_PHYSICAL.description: Number of low-physical-memory events fired since last ping

LOW_MEMORY_EVENTS_COMMIT_SPACE.description: Number of low-commit-space events fired since last ping

PAGE_FAULTS_HARD.description: Hard page faults (since last telemetry ping)

FONTLIST_INITOTHERFAMILYNAMES.description: Time(ms) spent on reading other family names from all fonts

FONTLIST_INITOTHERFAMILYNAMES_NO_DEFERRI.description: Time(ms) spent on reading other family names from all fonts for no timeout case

FONTLIST_INITFACENAMELISTS.description: Time(ms) spent on reading family names from all fonts

DWRITEFONT_INIT_PROBLEM.description: DirectWrite system fontlist initialization problem (1=GDI interop, 2=system font collection, 3=no fonts)

BAD_FALLBACK_FONT.description: system fallback font can't be used

SHUTDOWN_OK.description: Did the browser start after a successful shutdown

IMAGE_DECODE_LATENCY_US.description: Time spent decoding an image chunk (us)

IMAGE_DECODE_ON_DRAW_LATENCY.description: Time from starting a decode to it showing up on the screen (us)

IMAGE_DECODE_CHUNKS.description: Number of chunks per decode attempt

IMAGE_REQUEST_DISPATCHED.description: Track how many image requests required event dispatching because we were unable to predict the correct scheduler group: true if the request required dispatching. See image/imgRequestProxy.cpp for details.

KEYPRESS_PRESENT_LATENCY.description: Time between receiving a keypress event on the event loop and compositing its result onto the screen (ms)

SCROLL_PRESENT_LATENCY.description: Time between receiving a scroll event on the event loop and compositing its result onto the screen (ms)

CANVAS_WEBGL_ACCL_FAILURE_ID.description: Track the failure IDs that lead us to reject attempting to create an accelerated context. CANVAS_WEBGL_FAILURE_ID reports the overall WebGL status with the attempt to fallback.

CANVAS_WEBGL_FAILURE_ID.description: WebGL runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

HTTP_SUBITEM_OPEN_LATENCY_TIME.description: HTTP subitem channel: Page start -> subitem open() (ms)

HTTP_SUBITEM_FIRST_BYTE_LATENCY_TIME.description: HTTP subitem channel: Page start -> first byte received for subitem reply (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_DNS_ISSUE_TIME.description: HTTP page channel: open() -> DNS request issued (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_DNS_LOOKUP_TIME.description: HTTP page channel: DNS lookup time (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_TLS_HANDSHAKE.description: HTTP page channel: After TCP SYN to Ready for HTTP (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_TCP_CONNECTION_2.description: HTTP page channel: TCP SYN to Ready for HTTP (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_OPEN_TO_FIRST_SENT.description: HTTP page channel: Open -> first byte of request sent (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_FIRST_SENT_TO_LAST_RECEIVED.description: HTTP page channel: First byte of request sent -> last byte of response received (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_OPEN_TO_FIRST_RECEIVED.description: HTTP page channel: Open -> first byte of reply received (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_OPEN_TO_FIRST_FROM_CACHE_V2.description: HTTP page channel: Open -> cache read start (ms), [cache2]

HTTP_PAGE_CACHE_READ_TIME_V2.description: HTTP page channel: Cache read time (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_PAGE_REVALIDATION.description: HTTP page channel: Positive cache validation time (ms)

HTTP_PAGE_COMPLETE_LOAD_V2.description: HTTP page channel: Overall load time - all (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_PAGE_COMPLETE_LOAD_CACHED_V2.description: HTTP page channel: Overall load time - cache hits (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_PAGE_COMPLETE_LOAD_NET_V2.description: HTTP page channel: Overall load time - network (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_SUB_DNS_ISSUE_TIME.description: HTTP subitem channel: open() -> DNS request issued (ms)

HTTP_SUB_DNS_LOOKUP_TIME.description: HTTP subitem channel: DNS lookup time (ms)

HTTP_SUB_TLS_HANDSHAKE.description: HTTP subitem channel: After TCP SYN to Ready for HTTP (ms)

HTTP_SUB_TCP_CONNECTION_2.description: HTTP subitem channel: TCP SYN to Ready for HTTP (ms)

HTTP_SUB_OPEN_TO_FIRST_SENT.description: HTTP subitem channel: Open -> first byte of request sent (ms)

HTTP_SUB_FIRST_SENT_TO_LAST_RECEIVED.description: HTTP subitem channel: First byte of request sent -> last byte of response received (ms)

HTTP_SUB_OPEN_TO_FIRST_RECEIVED.description: HTTP subitem channel: Open -> first byte of reply received (ms)

HTTP_SUB_OPEN_TO_FIRST_FROM_CACHE_V2.description: HTTP subitem channel: Open -> cache read start (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_SUB_CACHE_READ_TIME_V2.description: HTTP subitem channel: Cache read time (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_SUB_REVALIDATION.description: HTTP subitem channel: Positive cache validation time (ms)

HTTP_SUB_COMPLETE_LOAD_V2.description: HTTP subitem channel: Overall load time - all (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_SUB_COMPLETE_LOAD_CACHED_V2.description: HTTP subitem channel: Overall load time - cache hits (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_SUB_COMPLETE_LOAD_NET_V2.description: HTTP subitem channel: Overall load time - network (ms) [cache2]

HTTP_TRANSACTION_IS_SSL.description: Whether an HTTP request occurred over TLS/SSL or not. Recorded during response processing for all requests.

HTTP_PAGELOAD_IS_SSL.description: Whether a HTTP page load was over SSL or not. Recorded during response processing for all first-party page loads.

HTTP_TRANSACTION_USE_ALTSVC.description: Whether a HTTP transaction was routed via Alt-Svc or not.

HTTP_TRANSACTION_USE_ALTSVC_OE.description: Whether a HTTP transaction routed via Alt-Svc was scheme=http

HTTP_ALTSVC_ENTRIES_PER_HEADER.description: How many alt-svc productions were seen in a single Alt-Svc header

HTTP_ALTSVC_MAPPING_CHANGED_TARGET.description: Whether or not a new alt-svc mapping would change the target hostname of the existing mapping

HTTP_SCHEME_UPGRADE_TYPE.description: Was the URL upgraded to HTTPS?

HTTP_NET_VS_CACHE_ONSTART_QSMALL_NORMALP.description: Network vs cache time load (OnStartRequest) difference (ms) for requests with a normal priority and small queue. Cache wins: 41-50 for 1-100ms, 51-59 for 101-1000ms, 60-68 for 1-10s, 69-73 for 11-60s and 74 for > 1m. Network wins: 39-30 for 1-100ms, 29-21 for 101-1000ms, 20-12 for 1-10s, 11-7 for 11-60s and 6 for > 1m.

HTTP_ONSTART_SUSPEND_TOTAL_TIME.description: Time in milliseconds that http channel spent suspended between AsyncOpen and OnStartRequest.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_WITH_NETWORK_USAGE_2.description: Whether we raced network with the cache.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_WITH_NETWORK_SAVED_TI.description: Time in milliseconds that we saved when we race cache with network.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_WITH_NETWORK_OCEC_ON_.description: Time in milliseconds between onStartRequest from the cache and onCacheEntryCheck. Report only when net wins and OCEC is before onStartRequest from net.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_BANDWIDTH_RACE_NETWOR.description: Amount of bytes received when we decide to race cache with network and network wins.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_BANDWIDTH_RACE_CACHE_.description: Amount of bytes received when we decide to race cache with network and cache wins.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_BANDWIDTH_NOT_RACE.description: Amount of bytes received when we decide not to race cache with network.

NETWORK_RACE_CACHE_VALIDATION.description: Stats for validation requests when cache won the race.

NETWORK_BACK_PRESSURE_SUSPENSION_RATE_V2.description: Collect whether the resource is suspended by back pressure. And split by local-ness.

NETWORK_BACK_PRESSURE_SUSPENSION_CP_TYPE.description: Collect the content policy when the resource is non-local and suspended by back pressure (0-44 from nsContentPolicyType in nsIContentPolicy.idl).

HTTP_CHILD_OMT_STATS.description: Stats about success rate of HTTP OMT request in content process, keyed by content policy.

TCP_FAST_OPEN_3.description: When a http connection is closed, track whether or not TCP Fast Open was used: 0=TFO_NOT_SET, 1=TFO_UNKNOWN, 2=TFO_DISABLED, 3=TFO_DISABLED_CONNECT, 4=TFO_NOT_TRIED, 5=TFO_TRIED, 6=TFO_DATA_SENT, 7=TFO_DATA_COOKIE_NOT_ACCEPTED, 8=TFO_FAILED_CONNECTION_REFUSED, 9=TFO_FAILED_NET_TIMEOUT, 10=TFO_FAILED_UNKNOW_ERROR, 11=TFO_FAILED_BACKUP_CONNECTION_TFO_NOT_TRIED, 12=TFO_FAILED_BACKUP_CONNECTION_TFO_TRIED, 13=TFO_FAILED_BACKUP_CONNECTION_TFO_DATA_SENT, 14=TFO_FAILED_BACKUP_CONNECTION_TFO_DATA_COOKIE_NOT_ACCEPTED, 15=TFO_FAILED_CONNECTION_REFUSED_NO_TFO_FAILED_TOO, 16=TFO_FAILED_NET_TIMEOUT__NO_TFO_FAILED_TOO, 17=TFO_FAILED_UNKNOW_ERROR_NO_TFO_FAILED_TOO, 18=TFO_FAILED_BACKUP_CONNECTION_NO_TFO_FAILED_TOO, 19=TFO_BACKUP_CONN. Please look at netwerk/base/TCPFastOpenLayer.h for more info

TCP_FAST_OPEN_STATUS.description: TCP Fast Open was: 0=enabled during the session, 1=not available or disabled in the os, 2=disabled by the pref, 3=disabled based on the too many connection failures, 4=disable based on too many http transaction stalls after a connection was idle.

NETWORK_HTTP_BACKUP_CONN_WON_1.description: For connection where TFO has not be use, collect telemetry on whether the backup connection or the primary connection was faster.

URLCLASSIFIER_UPDATE_ERROR.description: Whether or not an error was encountered while processing a Safe Browsing update (0 = success, 1 = unspecified error, 2 = addition of an already existing prefix, 3 = parser got into an infinite loop, 4 = removal index out of bounds, 5 = checksum mismatch, 6 = missing checksum, 7 = update while shutdown, 8 = cannot find table, 9 = build prefix failure, 10 = write disk failure, 11 = protocol parser error). Keyed by provider

URLCLASSIFIER_THREATHIT_NETWORK_ERROR.description: Whether or not an error was encountered while sending a Safe Browsing ThreatHit report. (0=sucess, 1=unknown error, 2=already connected, 3=not connected, 4=connection refused,5=net timeout, 6=offline, 7=port access not allowed, 8=net reset, 9=net interrupt, 10=proxy connection refused, 11=partial transfer, 12=inadequate security, 13=unknown host, 14=dns lookup queue full, 15=unknown proxy host)

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_IMPORT_MS.description: How long it took to import logins (passwords) from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser. The time for users to unlock Keychain on macOS is included in this time.

FX_MIGRATION_BOOKMARKS_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing bookmarks from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably.

FX_MIGRATION_HISTORY_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing history from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably.

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_JANK_MS.description: Accumulated timer delay (variance between when the timer was expected to fire and when it actually fired) in milliseconds as an indicator for decreased main-thread responsiveness while importing logins / passwords from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser (see gAvailableMigratorKeys in MigrationUtils.jsm). The import is happening on a background thread and should ideally not affect the UI noticeably. The time with the blocking Keychain dialog on macOS can skew this data.

FX_MIGRATION_BOOKMARKS_QUANTITY.description: How many bookmarks we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_HISTORY_QUANTITY.description: How many history visits we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_MIGRATION_LOGINS_QUANTITY.description: How many logins (passwords) we imported from another browser, keyed by the name of the browser.

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_EXISTING_DEFAULT_BR.description: The browser that was the default on the initial profile migration. The values correspond to the internal browser ID (see MigrationUtils.jsm)

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_DATA_RECENCY.description: The 'last modified' time of the data we imported on the initial profile migration (time delta with 'now' at the time of migration, in hours). Collected for all browsers for which migration data is available, and stored keyed by browser identifier (e.g. 'ie', 'edge', 'safari', etc.).

FX_STARTUP_MIGRATION_USED_RECENT_BROWSER.description: Whether the browser we migrated from was the browser with the most recent data. Keyed by that browser's identifier (e.g. 'ie', 'edge', 'safari', etc.).

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_PRIVACY_LEVEL.description: Session restore: The privacy level chosen by the user (0: Collect data from all sites, 1: Collect data only from non-HTTPS sites, 2: Collect no data)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_SERIALIZE_DATA_MS.description: Session restore: Time to JSON serialize session data (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_READ_FILE_MS.description: Session restore: Time to read the session data from the file on disk (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_WRITE_FILE_MS.description: Session restore: Time to write the session data to the file on disk (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_FILE_SIZE_BYTES.description: Session restore: The size of file sessionstore.js (bytes)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_CORRUPT_FILE.description: Session restore: Whether the file read on startup contained parse-able JSON

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_ALL_FILES_CORRUPT.description: Session restore: Whether none of the backup files contained parse-able JSON

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_RESTORE_WINDOW_MS.description: Session restore: Time spent blocking the main thread while restoring a window state (ms)

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_SEND_UPDATE_CAUSED_OO.description: Count of messages sent by SessionRestore from child frames to the parent and that cannot be transmitted as they eat up too much memory.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_AUTO_RESTORE_DURATION.description: Session restore: If the browser is setup to auto-restore tabs, this probe measures the time elapsed between the instant we start Session Restore and the instant we have finished restoring tabs eagerly. At this stage, the tabs that are restored on demand are not restored yet.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_MANUAL_RESTORE_DURATI.description: Session restore: If a session is restored by the user clicking on 'Restore Session', this probe measures the time elapsed between the instant the user has clicked and the instant we have finished restoring tabs eagerly. At this stage, the tabs that are restored on demand are not restored yet.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_TABS_RESTOR.description: Session restore: Number of tabs in the session that has just been restored.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_WINDOWS_RES.description: Session restore: Number of windows in the session that has just been restored.

FX_SESSION_RESTORE_NUMBER_OF_EAGER_TABS_.description: Session restore: Number of tabs restored eagerly in the session that has just been restored.

FX_TABLETMODE_PAGE_LOAD.description: Number of toplevel location changes in tablet and desktop mode (only used on win10 where tablet mode is available)

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_INDEX.description: Firefox: The index of the selected result in the URL bar popup

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_TYPE.description: Firefox: The type of the selected result in the URL bar popup. See BrowserUsageTelemetry.jsm:URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_TYPES for the result types.

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_INDEX_BY_TYPE.description: Firefox: The index of the selected result in the URL bar popup by the type of the selected result in the URL bar popup. See BrowserUsageTelemetry.jsm:URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_TYPES for the result types.

FX_URLBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_METHOD.description: The input method the user used to select a result in the urlbar. 'enter' => The user hit the Enter key on the heuristic result at index 0. 'enterSelection' => The user chose a non-heuristic result (in exotic ways) and then hit the Enter key. 'click' => The user clicked a result with the mouse. 'arrowEnterSelection' => The user chose a non-heuristic result using arrow keys and then hit the Enter key. 'tabEnterSelection' => The user chose a non-heuristic result using tab at least once and then hit the Enter key. 'rightClickEnter' => The user chose a non-heuristic result using right click and then hit the Enter key.

FX_SEARCHBAR_SELECTED_RESULT_METHOD.description: The input method the user used to select a result in the searchbar. 'enter' => The user hit the Enter key without choosing a result in the popup. 'enterSelection' => The user chose a result and then hit the Enter key. 'click' => The user clicked a result with the mouse.

INNERWINDOWS_WITH_MUTATION_LISTENERS.description: Deleted or to-be-reused innerwindow which has had mutation event listeners.

INNERWINDOWS_WITH_TEXT_EVENT_LISTENERS.description: Deleted or to-be-reused innerwindow which has had text event listeners in the default group.

ENCODING_OVERRIDE_SITUATION.description: Labeling status of top-level page when overriding encoding

LONG_REFLOW_INTERRUPTIBLE.description: Long running reflow, interruptible or not

XMLHTTPREQUEST_ASYNC_OR_SYNC.description: Type of XMLHttpRequest, async or sync

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SHUTDOWN_DATABASE_MS.description: Time to flush and close the localStorage database (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_PRELOAD_PENDING_ON_FIRST.description: True when we had to wait for a pending preload on first access to localStorage data, false otherwise

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETALLKEYS_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a list of all keys in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETKEY_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a key name in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETLENGTH_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return number of keys in domain's LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_GETVALUE_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we return a value for a key in LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SETVALUE_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we set a single key's value in LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_REMOVEKEY_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we remove a single key from LocalStorage (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_CLEAR_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to block before we clear LocalStorage for all domains (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_UNLOAD_BLOCKING_MS.description: Time to fetch LocalStorage data before we can clean the cache (ms)

LOCALDOMSTORAGE_SESSIONONLY_PRELOAD_BLOC.description: Time to fetch LocalStorage data before we can expose them as session only data (ms)

LOGIN_REPUTATION_LOGIN_WHITELIST_LOOKUP_.description: Time spent per login reputation service lookup local whitelist (ms)

RANGE_CHECKSUM_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with range checksum errors

BUCKET_ORDER_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with bucket order errors

TOTAL_COUNT_HIGH_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with total count high errors

TOTAL_COUNT_LOW_ERRORS.description: Number of histograms with total count low errors

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORIES_COUNT.description: Number of directories in the archive at scan

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_OLDEST_DIRECTORY_AGE.description: The age of the oldest Telemetry archive directory in months

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SCAN_PING_COUNT.description: Number of Telemetry pings in the archive at scan

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SESSION_PING_COUNT.description: Number of Telemetry pings added to the archive during the session

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_SIZE_MB.description: The size of the Telemetry archive (MB)

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTED_OVER_QUOTA.description: Number of Telemetry pings evicted from the archive during cleanup, because they were over the quota

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTED_OLD_DIRS.description: Number of Telemetry directories evicted from the archive during cleanup, because they were too old

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTING_DIRS_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting old directories

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_CHECKING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for checking if the archive is over-quota

TELEMETRY_ARCHIVE_EVICTING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting over-quota pings

TELEMETRY_PENDING_LOAD_FAILURE_READ.description: Number of pending Telemetry pings that failed to load from the disk

TELEMETRY_PENDING_LOAD_FAILURE_PARSE.description: Number of pending Telemetry pings that failed to parse once loaded from the disk

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_SIZE_MB.description: The size of the Telemetry pending pings directory (MB). The special value 17 is used to indicate over quota pings.

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_AGE.description: The age, in days, of the pending pings.

TELEMETRY_PENDING_PINGS_EVICTED_OVER_QUO.description: Number of Telemetry pings evicted from the pending pings directory during cleanup, because they were over the quota

TELEMETRY_PENDING_EVICTING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for evicting over-quota pending pings

TELEMETRY_PENDING_CHECKING_OVER_QUOTA_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes for checking if the pending pings are over-quota

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_SEND.description: Number of Telemetry pings discarded before sending because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_PENDING.description: Number of Telemetry pending pings discarded because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SIZE_EXCEEDED_ARCHIVED.description: Number of archived Telemetry pings discarded because they exceeded the maximum size

TELEMETRY_PING_SUBMISSION_WAITING_CLIENT.description: The number of pings that were submitted and had to wait for a client id (i.e. before it was cached or loaded from disk)

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_PENDING_PINGS_SIZE_M.description: The size (MB) of the Telemetry pending pings exceeding the maximum file size

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_ARCHIVED_PINGS_SIZE_.description: The size (MB) of the Telemetry archived, compressed, pings exceeding the maximum file size

TELEMETRY_DISCARDED_SEND_PINGS_SIZE_MB.description: The size (MB) of the ping data submitted to Telemetry exceeding the maximum size

TELEMETRY_COMPRESS.description: Time taken to compress telemetry object (ms)

TELEMETRY_SEND_SUCCESS.description: Time needed (in ms) for a successful send of a Telemetry ping to the servers and getting a reply back.

TELEMETRY_SEND_FAILURE.description: Time needed (in ms) for a failed send of a Telemetry ping to the servers and getting a reply back.

TELEMETRY_SEND_FAILURE_TYPE.description: Counts of the different ways sending a Telemetry ping can fail.

TELEMETRY_SEND_FAILURE_TYPE_PER_PING.description: Counts of the different ways sending a Telemetry ping can fail per ping type.

TELEMETRY_INVALID_PING_TYPE_SUBMITTED.description: Count of individual invalid ping types that were submitted to Telemetry.

TELEMETRY_INVALID_PAYLOAD_SUBMITTED.description: Count of individual invalid payloads that were submitted to Telemetry.

TELEMETRY_PING_EVICTED_FOR_SERVER_ERRORS.description: Number of Telemetry ping files evicted due to server errors (4XX HTTP code received)

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_LOAD.description: Set if Telemetry failed to load the session data from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_PARSE.description: Set if Telemetry failed to parse the session data loaded from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_VALIDATION.description: Set if Telemetry failed to validate the session data loaded from disk.

TELEMETRY_SESSIONDATA_FAILED_SAVE.description: Set if Telemetry failed to save the session data to disk.

TELEMETRY_EVENT_PING_SENT.description: Number of 'event' pings sent, by reason

TELEMETRY_EVENT_REGISTRATION_ERROR.description: Number of event registration failures, by field causing the failure

TELEMETRY_EVENT_RECORDING_ERROR.description: Number of event recording failures, by type of failure

STARTUP_CRASH_DETECTED.description: Whether there was a crash during the last startup

SAFE_MODE_USAGE.description: Whether the user is in safe mode (No, Yes, Forced)

SCRIPT_BLOCK_INCORRECT_MIME_3.description: Whether the script load has a MIME type of ...?  (unknown, javaScript, image, audio, video, text_plain, text_csv, text_xml, app_octet_stream, app_xml, app_json, text_json, text_html, empty). Whether the script load is from ...?  (serviceworker_load, worker_load, importSript_load, script_load). Whether the script load is of ...?  (same_origin, CORS_origin, cross_origin)

NEWTAB_PAGE_ENHANCED.description: New tab page is enhanced (showing suggestions).

NEWTAB_PAGE_PINNED_SITES_COUNT.description: Number of pinned sites on the new tab page.

NEWTAB_PAGE_BLOCKED_SITES_COUNT.description: Number of sites blocked from the new tab page.

MS_MESSAGE_REQUEST_TIME_MS.description: Firefox: Time in ms spent selecting and matching messages to user profile.

BROWSERPROVIDER_XUL_IMPORT_BOOKMARKS.description: Number of bookmarks in the original XUL places database

SECURITY_UI.description: Security-related UI events (addons, form submission, TLS certs, Safe Browsing, updates and geolocation). See /security/manager/ssl/nsISecurityUITelemetry.idl for the specific values.

IPC_TRANSACTION_CANCEL.description: True when an IPC transaction is canceled

IPC_SAME_PROCESS_MESSAGE_COPY_OOM_KB.description: Whenever the same-process MessageManager cannot be sent through sendAsyncMessage as it would cause an OOM, the size of the message content, in kb.

SLOW_ADDON_WARNING_STATES.description: The states the Slow Add-on Warning goes through. 0: Displayed the warning. 1: User clicked on 'Disable add-on'. 2: User clicked 'Ignore add-on for now'. 3: User clicked 'Ignore add-on permanently'. 4: User closed notification. Other values are reserved for future uses.

SLOW_ADDON_WARNING_RESPONSE_TIME.description: Time elapsed between before responding to Slow Add-on Warning UI (ms). Not updated if the user doesn't respond at all.

SEARCH_COUNTS.description: Records search counts for search access points and in-content searches. For search access points in general, the format is: <engine-name>.<search-access-point> For the urlbar when an internal @engine shortcut is used, the format is: <engine-name>.alias For in-content searches, the format is <provider>.in-content:[sap|sap-follow-on|organic]:[code|none]

SEARCH_SERVICE_INIT_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to initialize the search service

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_FETCH_TIME_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to fetch the country code

SEARCH_SERVICE_COUNTRY_FETCH_RESULT.description: Result of XHR request fetching the country-code. 0=SUCCESS, 1=SUCCESS_WITHOUT_DATA, 2=XHRTIMEOUT, 3=ERROR (rest reserved for finer-grained error codes later)

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_TIM.description: Set if the fetched country-code indicates US but the time-zone heuristic doesn't

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_TIMEZONE_MISMATCHED_CO.description: Set if the time-zone heuristic indicates US but the fetched country code doesn't

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_PLA.description: If we are on OSX and either the OSX countryCode or the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both do or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_NONUS_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_.description: If we are on OSX and neither the OSX countryCode nor the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both agree on the value or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_US_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_PLA.description: If we are on Windows and either the Windows countryCode or the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both do or true otherwise

SEARCH_SERVICE_NONUS_COUNTRY_MISMATCHED_.description: If we are on Windows and neither the Windows countryCode nor the geoip countryCode indicates we are in the US, set to false if they both agree on the value or true otherwise

TOUCH_ENABLED_DEVICE.description: Boolean indicating if a touch input device is detected.

COMPONENTS_SHIM_ACCESSED_BY_CONTENT.description: Whether content ever accesed the Components shim in this session

CHECK_ADDONS_MODIFIED_MS.description: Time (ms) it takes to figure out extension last modified time

SSL_SUCCESFUL_CERT_VALIDATION_TIME_MOZIL.description: Time spent on a successful cert verification in mozilla::pkix mode (ms)

SSL_INITIAL_FAILED_CERT_VALIDATION_TIME_.description: Time spent on an initially failed cert verification in mozilla::pkix mode (ms)

CRASH_STORE_COMPRESSED_BYTES.description: Size (in bytes) of the compressed crash store JSON file.

PDF_VIEWER_FONT_TYPES_2.description: The PDF document font types used

PDF_VIEWER_EMBED_2.description: A PDF document was embedded using OBJECT/EMBED and or an IFRAME

PDF_VIEWER_FORM_2.description: If a form was used, its type.

PDF_VIEWER_STREAM_TYPES_2.description: The PDF document compression stream types used

PDF_VIEWER_TIME_TO_VIEW_MS.description: Time spent to display first page in PDF Viewer (ms)

PLUGINS_NOTIFICATION_SHOWN.description: The number of times the click-to-activate notification was shown: false: shown by in-content activation true: shown by location bar activation

PLUGINS_NOTIFICATION_USER_ACTION_2.description: User actions taken in the plugin notification: 0: allownow 1: allowalways 2: block 3: blockalways; Note: 1 and 3 are unused from Firefox 69 onwards.

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_STATS.description: (Bug 1207089) Usage of popup notifications, keyed by ID (0 = Offered, 1..4 = Action (3 is unused), 5 = Click outside (unused), 6 = Leave page, 7 = Use 'X' (unused), 8 = Not now (unused), 10 = Open submenu, 11 = Learn more. Add 20 if happened after reopen.)

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_MAIN_ACTION_MS.description: (Bug 1207089) Time in ms between initially requesting a popup notification and triggering the main action, keyed by ID

POPUP_NOTIFICATION_DISMISSAL_MS.description: (Bug 1207089) Time in ms between displaying a popup notification and dismissing it without an action the first time, keyed by ID

PRINT_PREVIEW_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the browser enters print preview.

PRINT_PREVIEW_SIMPLIFY_PAGE_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the browser enters simplified mode on print preview.

PRINT_PREVIEW_SIMPLIFY_PAGE_UNAVAILABLE_.description: A counter incremented every time the simplified mode is unavailable on print preview.

PRINT_DIALOG_OPENED_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the user opens print dialog.

PRINT_COUNT.description: A counter incremented every time the user prints a document.

DEVTOOLS_COLD_TOOLBOX_OPEN_DELAY_MS.description: Time taken (in ms) to open the first DevTools toolbox. This is keyed by tool ID being opened [inspector, webconsole, jsdebugger, styleeditor, performance, memory, netmonitor, storage, dom].

DEVTOOLS_WARM_TOOLBOX_OPEN_DELAY_MS.description: Time taken (in ms) to open all but first DevTools toolbox. This is keyed by tool ID being opened [inspector, webconsole, jsdebugger, styleeditor, performance, memory, netmonitor, storage, dom].

DEVTOOLS_TOOLBOX_PAGE_RELOAD_DELAY_MS.description: Time taken (in ms) to update DevTools panel when reloading a page. This is keyed by tool ID being currently opened [inspector, webconsole, jsdebugger, styleeditor, performance, memory, netmonitor, storage, dom].

DEVTOOLS_INSPECTOR_NEW_ROOT_TO_RELOAD_DE.description: Time taken (in ms) to update the inspector during a page reload, starting from new-root event.

DEVTOOLS_DEBUGGER_DISPLAY_SOURCE_LOCAL_M.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to display a selected source to the user.

DEVTOOLS_DEBUGGER_DISPLAY_SOURCE_REMOTE_.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to display a selected source to the user.

DEVTOOLS_DEBUGGER_LOAD_SOURCE_MS.description: The time (in milliseconds) that it took to load a source for the user.

MEDIA_OGG_LOADED_IS_CHAINED.description: Whether while playing Ogg audio/video we encountered a chained Ogg. Reported on every audio or video element that loads an Ogg file.

MEDIA_MKV_CANPLAY_REQUESTED.description: Reports a true value when a page requests canPlayType for a matroska media type.

MEDIA_MP4_PARSE_SAMPLE_DESCRIPTION_ENTRI.description: Records if multiple codecs are present in a track's sample description entries. Recorded each time we process a track's metadata while parsing mp4s.
Records if multiple sets of crypto info are present in a track's sample description entries. Recorded each time we process a track's metadata while parsing mp4s.

MEDIA_MP4_PARSE_NUM_SAMPLE_DESCRIPTION_E.description: Counts the number of entries in the sample description box (stsd) for a track in an mp4. Recorded each time we process a track's metadata while parsing mp4s.

MEDIACACHESTREAM_LENGTH_KB.description: MediaCacheStream stream length size in KB; Either known size from the HTTP header if available, or otherwise the size actually downloaded. Recorded at every MediaCacheStream destruction.

MEDIA_DECODING_PROCESS_CRASH.description: Records a value each time GeckoView remote decoding process crashes unexpectedly while decoding media content.

WEBRTC_DTLS_CIPHER.description: The DTLS cipher (as integer) negotiated for a RTCPeerConnection. See TransportLayerDtls::RecordCipherTelemetry for the meaning of the values

WEBRTC_SRTP_CIPHER.description: The SRTP cipher (as label) negotiated for a RTCPeerConnection.

WEBRTC_DTLS_PROTOCOL_VERSION.description: The DTLS protocol version (as label) negotiated for a RTCPeerConnection.

WEBRTC_AVSYNC_WHEN_AUDIO_LAGS_VIDEO_MS.description: The delay (in milliseconds) when audio is behind video. Zero delay is counted. Measured every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AVSYNC_WHEN_VIDEO_LAGS_AUDIO_MS.description: The delay (in milliseconds) when video is behind audio. Zero delay is not counted. Measured every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_BANDWIDTH_K.description: Locally measured data rate of inbound video (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_BANDWIDTH_K.description: Locally measured data rate on inbound audio (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_BANDWIDTH_.description: Data rate deduced from RTCP from remote recipient of outbound video (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_BANDWIDTH_.description: Data rate deduced from RTCP from remote recipient of outbound audio (kbit/s). Computed every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_PACKETLOSS_.description: Locally measured packet loss on inbound video (permille). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_PACKETLOSS_.description: Locally measured packet loss on inbound audio (permille). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_PACKETLOSS.description: RTCP-reported packet loss by remote recipient of outbound video (permille). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_PACKETLOSS.description: RTCP-reported packet loss by remote recipient of outbound audio (permille). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_INBOUND_JITTER.description: Locally measured jitter on inbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_INBOUND_JITTER.description: Locally measured jitter on inbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_JITTER.description: RTCP-reported jitter by remote recipient of outbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_JITTER.description: RTCP-reported jitter by remote recipient of outbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call (for easy comparison).

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ERROR_RECOVERY_MS.description: Time to recover from a video error in ms

WEBRTC_VIDEO_RECOVERY_BEFORE_ERROR_PER_M.description: Number of losses recovered before error per min

WEBRTC_VIDEO_RECOVERY_AFTER_ERROR_PER_MI.description: Number of losses recovered after error per min

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODE_ERROR_TIME_PERMILLE.description: Percentage*10 (permille) of call decoding with errors or frozen due to errors

WEBRTC_VIDEO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_RTT.description: Roundtrip time of outbound video (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_AUDIO_QUALITY_OUTBOUND_RTT.description: Roundtrip time of outbound audio (ms). Sampled every second of a call.

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_BITRATE_AVG_PER_CAL.description: Video encoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_BITRATE_STD_DEV_PER.description: Standard deviation from video encoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_FRAMERATE_AVG_PER_C.description: Video encoder's average framerate (in fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_ENCODER_FRAMERATE_10X_STD_D.description: Standard deviation from video encoder's average framerate (in 1/10 fps) over an entire call

WEBRTC_VIDEO_DECODER_BITRATE_AVG_PER_CAL.description: Video decoder's average bitrate (in kbits/s) over an entire call

NETWORK_CACHE_METADATA_SIZE_2.description: Size of the metadata in bytes parsed from the disk.

NETWORK_CACHE_HASH_STATS.description: The longest hash match between a newly added entry and all the existing entries.

NETWORK_CACHE_ENTRY_COUNT.description: Number of entries in the cache keyed by cache capacity calculation type. Numbers are sampled periodically, every time 2GB of data is written to the cache.

NETWORK_CACHE_SIZE_SHARE.description: Percentage of the cache size occupied by given content type. Numbers are sampled periodically, every time 2GB of data is written to the cache.

NETWORK_CACHE_ENTRY_COUNT_SHARE.description: Percentage of the entries with the given content type. Numbers are sampled periodically, every time 2GB of data is written to the cache.

See https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/security/manager/ssl/RootHashes.inc for names of CAs. Bucket zero holds CAs not present in the list.

SSL_CT_POLICY_NON_COMPLIANT_CONNECTIONS_.description: Number of successfully established TLS connections NOT compliant with the Certificate Transparency Policy, by CA. See https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/security/manager/ssl/RootHashes.inc for names of CAs. Bucket zero holds CAs not present in the list.
