SHUTDOWN_PHASE_DURATION_TICKS_PROFILE_BE.description: Duration of shutdown phase profile-before-change, as measured by the shutdown terminator, in seconds of activity

BR_9_2_1_SUBJECT_ALT_NAMES.description: Baseline Requirements section 9.2.1: subject alternative names extension (0: ok, 1 or more: error)

BR_9_2_2_SUBJECT_COMMON_NAME.description: Baseline Requirements section 9.2.2: subject common name field (0: present, in subject alt. names; 1: not present; 2: not present in subject alt. names)

TAP_TO_LOAD_ENABLED.description: Whether or not a user has tap-to-load enabled.

ZOOMED_VIEW_ENABLED.description: Whether or not a user has the zoomed view (a.k.a. "Magnify small areas") enabled.

COOKIE_BEHAVIOR.description: Records the cookie behavior pref at startup.

TRACKING_PROTECTION_ENABLED.description: True if tracking protection is enabled globally at startup.

TRACKING_PROTECTION_PBM_DISABLED.description: True if tracking protection in Private Browsing mode is disabled at startup.

FINGERPRINTERS_BLOCKED_COUNT.description: A count of the status of fingerprinter blocking per top level page load. ('pageLoad' = There was a page load, 'blocked' = at least one fingerprinter was blocked, 'allowed' = at least one fingerprinter was detected and allowed.) Note, pageLoad is used as a baseline measurement.

CRYPTOMINERS_BLOCKED_COUNT.description: A count of the status of cryptominer blocking per top level page load. ('pageLoad' = There was a page load, 'blocked' = at least one cryptominer was blocked, 'allowed' = at least one cryptominer was detected and allowed.) Note, pageLoad is used as a baseline measurement.

FENNEC_TRACKING_PROTECTION_STATE.description: The state of the user-visible tracking protection setting (0 = Disabled, 1 = Enabled in PB, 2 = Enabled)

TRACKING_PROTECTION_SHIELD.description: Status of the shield icon for each top-level pageload (outside of Private Browsing mode) when tracking protection is enabled (0 = there was a page load, this is used as a baseline, 1 = shield crossed out because CB was disabled on this page by the user, 2 = shield shown because some content was blocked)

TRACKING_PROTECTION_EVENTS.description: (Fennec Only) A value of 0 is sent when the security UI changes on pages loaded outside of Private Browsing mode, a value of 1 is sent when users manually disable TP on that page, and 2 is sent when users manually re-enable TP on that page.

SERVICE_WORKER_LAUNCH_TIME.description: Time (ms) for a service worker to start up.

SERVICE_WORKER_REGISTRATION_LOADING.description: Tracking how ServiceWorkerRegistrar loads data before the first content is shown. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_FETCH_INTERCEPTION_DURATI.description: Time delta (ms) between when a network request is intercepted and the service worker provides a response. This includes: possible SW startup, worker thread dispatch, time until the respondWith() promise resolves, time to synthesize the response (including the body), worker thread to main thread dispatch. In the future this should include the IPC roundtrips involved in fetch interception.

SERVICE_WORKER_FETCH_EVENT_DISPATCH_MS.description: Time (in ms) measured between when the fetch event is dispatched by the Service Worker and before we execute the event listeners. This effectively measures the SW backlong, in the future this should also cover the IPC steps required to dispatch events to the SW.

SERVICE_WORKER_FETCH_EVENT_FINISH_SYNTHE.description: Time (in ms) measured between when the respondWith promise resolves and when we provide the response through the intercepted channel (FinishSynthesizedResponse).

SERVICE_WORKER_FETCH_EVENT_CHANNEL_RESET.description: Time (in ms) measured between when the fetch handler finished executing and when we reset the network channel.

SERVICE_WORKER_DESTROYED.description: Number of service workers destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

ONBEFOREUNLOAD_PROMPT_ACTION.description: What button a user clicked in an onbeforeunload prompt.  (Stay on Page = 0, Leave Page = 1, prompt aborted = 2)

ONBEFOREUNLOAD_PROMPT_COUNT.description: How many onbeforeunload prompts has the user encountered in their session?

SUBPROCESS_ABNORMAL_ABORT.description: Counts of plugin/content process abnormal shutdown, whether or not a crash report was available.

SUBPROCESS_CRASHES_WITH_DUMP.description: Counts of plugin and content process crashes which are reported with a crash dump.

SUBPROCESS_LAUNCH_FAILURE.description: Counts the number of times launching a subprocess fails. Counts are by subprocess-type using the GeckoProcessType enum.

PROCESS_CRASH_SUBMIT_ATTEMPT.description: An attempt to submit a crash. Keyed on the CrashManager Crash.type.

PROCESS_CRASH_SUBMIT_SUCCESS.description: The submission status when main/plugin/content crashes are submitted. 1 is success, 0 is failure. Keyed on the CrashManager Crash.type.

DATA_STORAGE_ENTRIES.description: The number of entries in persistent DataStorage (HSTS and HPKP data, basically)

VIDEO_PLAY_TIME_MS.description: Total time spent playing video in milliseconds. This reports the total play time for an HTML Media Element whenever it is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded, or when the mute status changes when the AudioChannelAPI pref is set.

VIDEO_HIDDEN_PLAY_TIME_MS.description: Total time spent playing video while element is hidden, in milliseconds. This reports the total hidden play time for an HTML Media Element whenever it is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded, or when the mute status changes when the AudioChannelAPI pref is set.

VIDEO_HIDDEN_PLAY_TIME_PERCENTAGE.description: Percentage of total time spent playing video while element is hidden. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INFERRED_DECODE_SUSPEND_PERCENTAGE.description: Percentage of total time spent *not* fully decoding video while element is hidden (simulated, even when feature is not enabled). Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INTER_KEYFRAME_AVERAGE_MS.description: Average interval between video keyframes in played videos, in milliseconds. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_INTER_KEYFRAME_MAX_MS.description: Maximum interval between video keyframes in played videos, in milliseconds; '0' means only 1 keyframe found. Keyed by audio presence and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 576, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0<h<=240', 'AV,h>2160'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages. This is reported whenever an HTML Media Element is suspended or resumed, such as when the page is unloaded.

VIDEO_SUSPEND_RECOVERY_TIME_MS.description: Time taken for a video to resume after decoding was suspended, in milliseconds. Keyed by audio presence, hw acceleration, and by height ranges (boundaries: 240. 480, 720, 1080, 2160), e.g.: 'V,0-240', 'AV(hw),2160+'; and 'All' will accumulate all percentages.

VIDEO_VP9_BENCHMARK_FPS.description: 720p VP9 decode benchmark measurement in frames per second

MEDIA_PLAY_PROMISE_RESOLUTION.description: Records whether promise returned by HTMLMediaElement.play() successfully resolved, or the error code which it was rejected with.

MEDIA_CODEC_USED.description: Count of use of audio/video codecs in HTMLMediaElements and WebAudio. Those with 'resource' prefix are approximate; report based on HTTP ContentType or sniffing. Those with 'webaudio' prefix are for WebAudio.

FX_SANITIZE_TOTAL.description: Sanitize: Total time it takes to sanitize (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_CACHE.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize the cache (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_COOKIES_2.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize firefox cookies (ms). A subset of FX_SANITIZE_COOKIES.

FX_SANITIZE_HISTORY.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize history (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_FORMDATA.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize stored form data (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_DOWNLOADS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize recent downloads (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_SESSIONS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize saved sessions (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_SITESETTINGS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize site-specific settings (ms)

FX_SANITIZE_OPENWINDOWS.description: Sanitize: Time it takes to sanitize the open windows list (ms). On Android, this is the time it takes to close all open tabs (ms).

PWMGR_BLOCKLIST_NUM_SITES.description: The number of sites for which the user has explicitly rejected saving logins

PWMGR_FORM_AUTOFILL_RESULT.description: The result of auto-filling a login form. See http://mzl.la/1Mbs6jL for bucket descriptions.

PWMGR_LOGIN_LAST_USED_DAYS.description: Time in days each saved login was last used

PWMGR_LOGIN_PAGE_SAFETY.description: The safety of a page where we see a password field. (0: safe page & safe submit; 1: safe page & unsafe submit; 2: safe page & unknown submit; 3: unsafe page & safe submit; 4: unsafe page & unsafe submit; 5: unsafe page & unknown submit)

PWMGR_NUM_PASSWORDS_PER_HOSTNAME.description: The number of passwords per hostname

PWMGR_NUM_SAVED_PASSWORDS.description: Total number of saved logins, including those that cannot be decrypted

PWMGR_PASSWORD_INPUT_IN_FORM.description: Whether an <input type=password> is associated with a <form> when it is added to a document

PWMGR_PROMPT_REMEMBER_ACTION.description: Action taken by user through prompt for creating a login. (0=Prompt displayed [always recorded], 1=Add login, 2=Don't save now, 3=Never save)

PWMGR_PROMPT_UPDATE_ACTION.description: Action taken by user through prompt for modifying a login. (0=Prompt displayed [always recorded], 1=Update login)

PWMGR_SAVING_ENABLED.description: Number of users who have password saving on globally

PWMGR_USERNAME_PRESENT.description: Whether a saved login has a username

SLOW_SCRIPT_PAGE_COUNT.description: The number of pages that trigger slow script notices

SLOW_SCRIPT_NOTIFY_DELAY.description: The difference between the js slow script timeout for content set in prefs and the actual time we waited before displaying the notification (msec).

PLUGIN_HANG_NOTICE_COUNT.description: Count plugin hang notices in e10s

SERVICE_WORKER_SPAWN_ATTEMPTS.description: Count attempts to spawn a ServiceWorker for a domain. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_WAS_SPAWNED.description: Count ServiceWorkers that really did get a thread created for them. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a ServiceWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SHARED_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a SharedWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SHARED_WORKER_DESTROYED.description: Number of shared workers destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

DEDICATED_WORKER_SPAWN_GETS_QUEUED.description: Tracking whether a DedicatedWorker spawn gets queued due to hitting max workers per domain limit. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

DEDICATED_WORKER_DESTROYED.description: Number of dedicated workers destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

SERVICE_WORKER_REGISTRATIONS.description: Count how many registrations occurs. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_CONTROLLED_DOCUMENTS.description: Count whenever a document is controlled. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_UPDATED.description: Count ServiceWorkers scripts that are updated. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

SERVICE_WORKER_LIFE_TIME.description: Tracking how long a ServiceWorker stays alive after it is spawned. File bugs in Core::DOM in case of a Telemetry regression.

GRAPHICS_SANITY_TEST.description: Reports results from the graphics sanity test to track which drivers are having problems (0=TEST_PASSED, 1=TEST_FAILED_RENDER, 2=TEST_FAILED_VIDEO, 3=TEST_CRASHED)

READER_MODE_PARSE_RESULT.description: The result of trying to parse a document to show in reader view (0=Success, 1=Error too many elements, 2=Error in worker, 3=Error no article)

READER_MODE_DOWNLOAD_RESULT.description: The result of trying to download a document to show in reader view (0=Success, 1=Error XHR, 2=Error no document)

DEFECTIVE_PERMISSIONS_SQL_REMOVED.description: Record the removal of defective permissions.sqlite

GRAPHICS_DRIVER_STARTUP_TEST.description: Reports whether or not graphics drivers crashed during startup.

GRAPHICS_SANITY_TEST_REASON.description: Reports why a graphics sanity test was run. 0=First Run, 1=App Updated, 2=Device Change, 3=Driver Change, 4=Advanced Layers Config Change.

TRANSLATION_OPPORTUNITIES.description: A number of successful and failed attempts to translate a document

TRANSLATION_OPPORTUNITIES_BY_LANGUAGE.description: A number of successful and failed attempts to translate a document grouped by language

TRANSLATED_PAGES.description: A number of sucessfully translated pages

TRANSLATED_PAGES_BY_LANGUAGE.description: A number of sucessfully translated pages by language

TRANSLATED_CHARACTERS.description: A number of sucessfully translated characters

DENIED_TRANSLATION_OFFERS.description: A number of tranlation offers the user denied

AUTO_REJECTED_TRANSLATION_OFFERS.description: A number of auto-rejected tranlation offers

REQUESTS_OF_ORIGINAL_CONTENT.description: A number of times the user requested to see the original content of a translated page

CHANGES_OF_TARGET_LANGUAGE.description: A number of times when the target language was changed by the user

CHANGES_OF_DETECTED_LANGUAGE.description: A number of changes of detected language before (true) or after (false) translating a page for the first time.

SHOULD_TRANSLATION_UI_APPEAR.description: Tracks situations when the user opts for displaying translation UI

SHOULD_AUTO_DETECT_LANGUAGE.description: Tracks situations when the user opts for auto-detecting the language of a page

VIDEO_EME_REQUEST_SUCCESS_LATENCY_MS.description: Time spent waiting for a navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess call to succeed.

VIDEO_EME_REQUEST_FAILURE_LATENCY_MS.description: Time spent waiting for a navigator.requestMediaKeySystemAccess call to fail.

WEAVE_DEVICE_COUNT_DESKTOP.description: Number of desktop devices (including this device) associated with this Sync account. Recorded each time Sync successfully completes the 'clients' engine.

WEAVE_DEVICE_COUNT_MOBILE.description: Number of mobile devices associated with this Sync account. Recorded each time Sync successfully completes the 'clients' engine.

CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED.description: Number of content documents destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

TOP_LEVEL_CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED.description: Number of top-level content documents destroyed; used in conjunction with use counter histograms

PUSH_API_NOTIFY.description: Number of push messages that were successfully decrypted and delivered to a ServiceWorker.

D3D11_SYNC_HANDLE_FAILURE.description: Number of times the D3D11 compositor failed to get a texture sync handle.

GFX_CONTENT_FAILED_TO_ACQUIRE_DEVICE.description: Failed to create a gfx content device. 0=content d3d11, 1=image d3d11, 2=d2d1.

WEBFONT_DOWNLOAD_TIME_AFTER_START.description: Time after navigationStart webfont download completed (ms)

WEBFONT_SRCTYPE.description: Font src type loaded (1 = local, 2 = url, 3 = data)

WEBFONT_PER_PAGE.description: Number of fonts loaded at page load

WEBFONT_SIZE_PER_PAGE.description: Size of all fonts loaded at page load (kb)

ALERTS_SERVICE_DND_ENABLED.description: XUL-only: whether the user has toggled do not disturb.

PLUGIN_DRAWING_MODEL.description: Plugin drawing model. 0 when windowed, otherwise NPDrawingModel + 1.

DOM_SCRIPT_KIND.description: Record the kind of every script loaded in a document.

DOM_SCRIPT_LOADING_SOURCE.description: Record the input from which the bytes are coming from, for each script in a document.

DOM_SCRIPT_PRELOAD_RESULT.description: Whether a preloaded script was used or the reason it was not used.

VIDEO_DROPPED_FRAMES_PROPORTION.description: Percentage of frames decoded frames dropped in an HTMLVideoElement

IPC_MESSAGE_SIZE2.description: Measures the size of all IPC messages sent that are >= 4096 bytes.

IPC_REPLY_SIZE.description: Measures the size of IPC messages by message name

IPC_SYNC_MAIN_LATENCY_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend waiting for sync IPC messages to finish sending, keyed by message name. Note: only messages that wait for more than 500 microseconds and block the main thread are included in this probe.

SANDBOX_HAS_SECCOMP_BPF.description: Whether the system has seccomp-bpf capability

SANDBOX_HAS_SECCOMP_TSYNC.description: Whether the system has seccomp-bpf thread-sync capability

SANDBOX_HAS_USER_NAMESPACES.description: Whether our process succedeed in creating a user namespace

SANDBOX_HAS_USER_NAMESPACES_PRIVILEGED.description: Whether the system has the capability to create privileged user namespaces

SANDBOX_MEDIA_ENABLED.description: Whether the sandbox is enabled for media/GMP plugins

SANDBOX_CONTENT_ENABLED.description: Whether the sandbox is enabled for the content process

SANDBOX_REJECTED_SYSCALLS.description: System calls blocked by a seccomp-bpf sandbox policy; limited to syscalls where we would crash on Nightly.  The key is generally the architecture and syscall ID but in some cases we include non-personally-identifying information from the syscall arguments; see the function SubmitToTelemetry in security/sandbox/linux/reporter/SandboxReporter.cpp for details.

SANDBOX_FAILED_LAUNCH_KEYED.description: Error code when a Windows sandboxed process fails to launch, keyed by process type and Windows error code. See https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?q=ResultCode++path%3Asandbox_types.h&redirect=true for definitions of the error codes.

SYNC_WORKER_OPERATION.description: Tracking how long a Worker thread is blocked when a sync operation is executed on the main-thread.

SUBPROCESS_KILL_HARD.description: Counts the number of times a subprocess was forcibly killed, and the reason.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_DUMP_UNAVAILABLE.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed was unable to find a crash dump.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_PRESENTED.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed appeared and found a crash dump.

FX_CONTENT_CRASH_NOT_SUBMITTED.description: Counts the number of times that about:tabcrashed was unloaded without submitting.

D3D11_COMPOSITING_FAILURE_ID.description: D3D11 compositor runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

OPENGL_COMPOSITING_FAILURE_ID.description: OpenGL compositor runtime and dynamic failure IDs. This will record a count for each context creation success or failure. Each failure id is a unique identifier that can be traced back to a particular failure branch or blocklist rule.

WEBVTT_TRACK_KINDS.description: Number of the use of the subtitles kind track. 0=Subtitles, 1=Captions, 2=Descriptions, 3=Chapters, 4=Metadata, 5=Undefined Error

CONTAINER_USED.description: Records a value each time a builtin container is opened. 1=personal 2=work 3=banking 4=shopping. Does not record usage of user-created containers.

UNIQUE_CONTAINERS_OPENED.description: Tracking the unique number of opened Containers.

TOTAL_CONTAINERS_OPENED.description: Tracking the total number of opened Containers.

NUMBER_OF_PROFILES.description: Number of named browser profiles for the current user, as reported by the profile service at startup.

TIME_TO_FIRST_CLICK_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from the first non-blank paint to the creation time of the next click event per top-level content browsing context.

TIME_TO_FIRST_KEY_INPUT_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from the first non-blank paint to the creation time of the next key event per top-level content browsing context.

TIME_TO_FIRST_MOUSE_MOVE_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from the first non-blank paint to the creation time of the next mouse move event per top-level content browsing context.

TIME_TO_FIRST_SCROLL_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from the first non-blank paint to the creation time of the next scroll event per top-level content browsing context.

TIME_TO_FIRST_INTERACTION_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from the first non-blank paint to the creation time of the next click, key, mouse or scroll event per top-level content browsing context.

CONTENT_PAINT_TIME.description: Time spent in the paint pipeline for content in milliseconds.

CONTENT_FULL_PAINT_TIME.description: Time spent in the paint pipeline until it's ready for composition in milliseconds.

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor.

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME_VSYNC.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from the vsync that started a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor.

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME_WITH_SVG.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor, for frames that contained an SVG to be drawn by WebRender

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME_WITHOUT_RESOURCE_UPLO.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor by WebRender, excluding time spent uploading resources

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME_WITHOUT_UPLOAD.description: The time, in percentage of a vsync interval, spent from beginning a paint in the content process until that frame is presented in the compositor by WebRender, excluding time spent uploading any content

CONTENT_FRAME_TIME_REASON.description: The reason that CONTENT_FRAME_TIME recorded a slow (>200) result, if any.

CONTENT_LARGE_PAINT_PHASE_WEIGHT.description: Percentages of times for phases in an expensive content paint relative to the time spent in the entire expensive paint. ("dl" = Display list, "flb" = Frame layer builder, "fr" = Flush rasterization, "r" = Rasterization)

CONTENT_SMALL_PAINT_PHASE_WEIGHT.description: Percentages of times for phases in a normal content paint relative to the time spent in the entire normal paint. ("dl" = Display list, "flb" = Frame layer builder, "fr" = Flush rasterization, "r" = Rasterization)

GPU_WAIT_TIME_MS.description: The number of milliseconds we spend waiting for the GPU

NARRATE_CONTENT_BY_LANGUAGE_2.description: Number of Narrate initialization attempts and successes broken up by content's language (ISO 639-1 code) (0 = initialization attempt, 1 = successfully initialized)

NARRATE_CONTENT_SPEAKTIME_MS.description: Time in MS that content is narrated in 10 second increments up to 5 minutes

TABCHILD_PAINT_TIME.description: Time spent painting the contents of a remote browser (ms).

TIME_TO_NON_BLANK_PAINT_MS.description: The time between navigation start and the first non-blank paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and non-blank paint. The non-blank paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.

TIME_TO_NON_BLANK_PAINT_NETOPT_MS.description: The time between navigation start and the first non-blank paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and non-blank paint. The non-blank paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.  This probe only accumulates when there were active-tab network load optimizations happening during the interval.

TIME_TO_NON_BLANK_PAINT_NO_NETOPT_MS.description: The time between navigation start and the first non-blank paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and non-blank paint. The non-blank paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.  This probe only accumulates when there were no active-tab network load optimizations happening during the interval.

TIME_TO_FIRST_CONTENTFUL_PAINT_MS.description: The time between navigation start and the first contentful paint of a foreground root content document, in milliseconds. This only records documents that were in an active docshell throughout the whole time between navigation start and contentful paint. The contentful paint timestamp is taken during display list building and does not include rasterization or compositing of that paint.

TAB_AUDIO_INDICATOR_USED.description: The total usage amount of the operations of tab audio indicator, mute=0 , unmuted=1, unblockByVisitingTab=2, unblockingByClickingIcon=3

EXTENSION_INSTALL_PROMPT_RESULT.description: Results of displaying add-on installation notifications.

IPC_READ_MAIN_THREAD_LATENCY_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend waiting on the main thread for IPC messages to deserialize their parameters. Note: only messages that take more than 500 microseconds are included in this probe. This probe is keyed on the IPDL message name.

IPC_WRITE_MAIN_THREAD_LATENCY_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend waiting on the main thread for IPC messages to serialize their parameters. Note: only messages that take more than 500 microseconds are included in this probe. This probe is keyed on the IPDL message name.

INPUT_EVENT_QUEUED_CLICK_MS.description: Time (ms) for the mouse click event to dispatch, but before handlers executing.

INPUT_EVENT_QUEUED_KEYBOARD_MS.description: Time (ms) for the keyboard event to dispatch, but before handlers executing.

INPUT_EVENT_QUEUED_APZ_TOUCH_MOVE_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled touch move event to dispatch, but before handlers executing.

INPUT_EVENT_QUEUED_APZ_MOUSE_MOVE_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled mouse move event to dispatch, but before handlers executing.

INPUT_EVENT_QUEUED_APZ_WHEEL_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled wheel event to dispatch, but before handlers executing.

INTERMEDIATE_PRELOADING_ERRORS.description: Errors occurred during intermediate certificate preloading.

INTERMEDIATE_PRELOADING_UPDATE_TIME_MS.description: Number of milliseconds to update the pre-loaded data, if updated.

IPC_SYNC_MESSAGE_MANAGER_LATENCY_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend waiting for sync message manager IPC messages to finish sending, keyed by message name. Note: only messages that wait for more than 500 microseconds are included in this probe.

TIME_TO_DOM_LOADING_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domLoading.

TIME_TO_DOM_INTERACTIVE_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domInteractive.

TIME_TO_DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_START_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventStart.

TIME_TO_DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_START_ACTIVE_.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventStart for all-the-time active page for which some of the network loading optimization happened.
Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventStart for all-the-time active page for which none of the network loading optimization happened.

TIME_TO_DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_END_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domContentLoadedEventEnd.

TIME_TO_DOM_COMPLETE_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to domComplete.

TIME_TO_LOAD_EVENT_START_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to loadEventStart.

TIME_TO_LOAD_EVENT_START_ACTIVE_NETOPT_M.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to loadEventStart for all-the-time active page for which some of the network loading optimization happened.

TIME_TO_LOAD_EVENT_START_ACTIVE_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to loadEventStart for all-the-time active page for which none of the network loading optimization happened.

TIME_TO_LOAD_EVENT_END_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to loadEventEnd.

TIME_TO_RESPONSE_START_MS.description: Time in milliseconds from navigationStart to responseStart.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_MOUSE_UP_MS.description: Time (ms) for the mouse up event spent in handlers.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_MOUSE_DOWN_MS.description: Time (ms) for the mouse down event spent in handlers.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_KEYBOARD_MS.description: Time (ms) for the keyboard event spent in handlers.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_APZ_TOUCH_MOVE_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled touch move event spent in handlers.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_APZ_MOUSE_MOVE_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled mouse move event spent in handlers.

INPUT_EVENT_HANDLED_APZ_WHEEL_MS.description: Time (ms) for the APZ handled wheel event spent in handlers.

IPC_SYNC_RECEIVE_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend processing sync IPC messages in the receiving process, keyed by message name. Note: only messages that take over 500 microseconds are included in this probe.

WEBEXT_BACKGROUND_PAGE_LOAD_MS.description: The amount of time it takes to load a WebExtensions background page, from when the build function is called to when the page has finished processing the onload event.

WEBEXT_BACKGROUND_PAGE_LOAD_MS_BY_ADDONI.description: The amount of time it takes to load a WebExtensions background page, from when the build function is called to when the page has finished processing the onload event, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_BROWSERACTION_POPUP_OPEN_MS.description: The amount of time it takes for a BrowserAction popup to open.

WEBEXT_BROWSERACTION_POPUP_OPEN_MS_BY_AD.description: The amount of time it takes for a BrowserAction popup to open, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_BROWSERACTION_POPUP_PRELOAD_RESUL.description: The number of times a browserAction popup is preloaded and results in one of the categories.
The number of times a browserAction popup is preloaded and results in one of the categories, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_CONTENT_SCRIPT_INJECTION_MS.description: The amount of time it takes for content scripts from a WebExtension to be injected into a window.

WEBEXT_CONTENT_SCRIPT_INJECTION_MS_BY_AD.description: The amount of time it takes for content scripts from a WebExtension to be injected into a window, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_EXTENSION_STARTUP_MS.description: The amount of time it takes for a WebExtension to start up, from when the startup function is called to when the startup promise resolves.

WEBEXT_EXTENSION_STARTUP_MS_BY_ADDONID.description: The amount of time it takes for a WebExtension to start up, from when the startup function is called to when the startup promise resolves, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_PAGEACTION_POPUP_OPEN_MS.description: The amount of time it takes for a PageAction popup to open.

WEBEXT_PAGEACTION_POPUP_OPEN_MS_BY_ADDON.description: The amount of time it takes for a PageAction popup to open, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_GET_MS.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a get via storage.local using the JSONFile backend.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_GET_MS_BY_ADDONID.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a get via storage.local using the JSONFile backend, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_SET_MS.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a set via storage.local using the JSONFile backend.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_SET_MS_BY_ADDONID.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a set via storage.local using the JSONFile backend, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_IDB_GET_MS.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a get via storage.local using the IndexedDB backend.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_IDB_GET_MS_BY_ADDON.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a get via storage.local using the IndexedDB backend, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_IDB_SET_MS.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a set via storage.local using the IndexedDB backend.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_IDB_SET_MS_BY_ADDON.description: The amount of time it takes to perform a set via storage.local using the IndexedDB backend, keyed by addon id.

WEBEXT_STORAGE_LOCAL_IDB_MIGRATE_RESULT_.description: The number of times a storage.local backend data migration has been completed and results in one of the categories.

WEBEXT_USER_SCRIPT_INJECTION_MS.description: The amount of time it takes for userScripts from a WebExtension to be injected into a window.

WEBEXT_USER_SCRIPT_INJECTION_MS_BY_ADDON.description: The amount of time it takes for userScripts from a WebExtension to be injected into a window, keyed by addon id.

EXTENSION_UPDATE_TYPE.description: The type of update manifest served for a given update request.

NOTIFY_OBSERVERS_LATENCY_MS.description: Measures the number of milliseconds we spend synchronously notifying observers, keyed by topic. Note: only NotifyObservers calls which take over 500 microseconds are included in this probe.

HOVER_UNTIL_UNSELECTED_TAB_OPENED.description: Measure the time how long the cursor is hovering before opening the unselcted tab. Only record the data if someone requests for sending unselected tab hover msg.

FXRPC_FF_INSTALLATION_FROM.description: Determine if FireFox is installed at user's PC already, or they are new installation from Firefox Reality PC distribution channels.

FXRPC_ENTRY_METHOD.description: The approach of users enter Firefox Reality PC.

WEBVR_USERS_VIEW_IN.description: The amount of sessions who view VR content in: 2D=0, Oculus=1, OpenVR=2.

WEBVR_TIME_SPENT_VIEWING_IN_2D.description: The amount of time spent(ms) of a session for viewing VR content in 2D.

WEBVR_TIME_SPENT_VIEWING_IN_OCULUS.description: The amount of time spent(ms) of a session for viewing content in Oculus.

WEBVR_TIME_SPENT_VIEWING_IN_OPENVR.description: The amount of time spent(ms) of a session for viewing content in OpenVR.

WEBVR_DROPPED_FRAMES_IN_OCULUS.description: The average number of dropped frames per sec in Oculus, sent when user exits WebVR content.

WEBVR_DROPPED_FRAMES_IN_OPENVR.description: The average number of dropped frames per sec in OpenVR, sent when user exits WebVR content.

URLCLASSIFIER_UI_EVENTS.description: URL CLassifier-related (aka Safe Browsing) UI events. See nsIUrlClassifierUITelemetry.idl for the specific values.

WEBAUTHN_CREATE_CREDENTIAL_MS.description: Time in milliseconds to complete a WebAuthn create credential.

WEBAUTHN_GET_ASSERTION_MS.description: Time in milliseconds to complete a WebAuthn get assertion.

VIDEO_UNBLACKINGLISTING_DXVA_DRIVER_RUNT.description: The runtime status, sent when a remote HW video decoder is shutdown, of previously-blacklisted driver: 0:remote HW-decoding and GPU process didn't crash, 1:remote HW-decoding and GPU process crashed. The histogram is keyed by the blacklisted driver name.

FORM_FILLING_REQUIRED_TIME_MS.description: Milliseconds between starting to fill an autofill-eligible form field and submitting the form, keyed by the combination of form type and filling type.

GFX_OMTP_PAINT_TIME.description: Amount of time in tenths of a millisecond from the beginning of the first async paint until all async paints are finished.

GFX_OMTP_PAINT_WAIT_TIME.description: Amount of time in milliseconds the main thread spends waiting for the paint thread to complete, if the time was greater than 200us.

GFX_OMTP_PAINT_TASK_COUNT.description: The amount of async paint tasks queued to the paint thread during a layer transaction.

PREFERENCES_FILE_LOAD_TIME_US.description: The time (in microseconds) to load, parse and process each prefs file, keyed by filename.

PREFERENCES_FILE_LOAD_SIZE_B.description: The size (in bytes) of each prefs file loaded, keyed by filename.

PREFERENCES_FILE_LOAD_NUM_PREFS.description: The number of prefs in each prefs file loaded, keyed by filename.

PERMISSION_REQUEST_ORIGIN_SCHEME.description: Permission requests (showing a permission prompt) by origin scheme (0=other,1=http,2=https).

PERMISSION_REQUEST_HANDLING_USER_INPUT.description: Permission requests (showing a permission prompt) by whether they were requested from code handling a user input event.

PROFILE_DIRECTORY_FILE_AGE.description: Age of files scanned in profile directory in days when determining initial profile age.

BFCACHE_COMBO.description: The common combinations of BFCacheStatus when we determine whether the page can be BFCached or not; If it's BFCached, we record BFCache_Success; Success_Not_Toplevel represents the number of not the only top level document in BrowsingContextGroup's documents that are BFCached, and BFCache_Success includes Success_Not_Toplevel; If it's not and it falls under common failure reasons combinations, we record the corresponding combination; Otherwise, we record Other to indicate this is not a common failure

TYPES_OF_USER_CLICKS.description: When a user click(Mousedown + Mouseup event by using the left mouse button) happens, record if it's a click on browser chrome (parent process), a anchor element or an element which has non-privileged click event listener associated

BFCACHE_PAGE_RESTORED.description: Whether bfcache is used when loading a page from session history

HIDDEN_VIEWPORT_OVERFLOW_TYPE.description: How common are different types of out-of-reach viewport overflow?

WR_SCENEBUILD_TIME.description: WebRender scene build time in milliseconds

WR_SCENESWAP_TIME.description: WebRender scene swap time in miliseconds

TOUCHBAR_BUTTON_PRESSES.description: What buttons are pressed most often on the Mac Touch Bar?

AUDIO_TRACK_SILENCE_PROPORTION.description: In order to know how many silent audio track in the web comparing to other normal media, we record the silence proportion of audio track of media element. The range of value is from 0% - 100%.

WEB_AUDIO_BECOMES_AUDIBLE_TIME.description: How long the AudioContext would become audible since it was created, time unit is seconds.

AUTOPLAY_DEFAULT_SETTING_CHANGE.description: counts the number of times a user changed the default autoplay behavior to each setting during a subsession.

WEB_AUDIO_AUTOPLAY.description: The number of times an AudioContext is allowed to start after being blocked, or the number of AudioContexts attempting to start which were never blocked or never allowed.

MEDIA_PLAYED_TIME_AFTER_AUTOPLAY_BLOCKED.description: The number of times autoplay media (audio and video), which has been blocked by autoplay policy, played exactly 7 seconds or more, or less than 7 seconds after it has been resumed from the blocked state. If media's duration is less than 7 seconds and it played to the end before user pauses it, it would be in another category which is different from 'play >= 7 seconds' and 'play < 7 seconds'.

QM_REPOSITORIES_INITIALIZATION_TIME_V2.description: Time (ms) for the QuotaManager to initialize repositories.

QM_FIRST_INITIALIZATION_ATTEMPT.description: True if the first initialization attempt succeeded, keyed by the initialization type.

GV_PAGE_LOAD_PROGRESS_MS.description: GeckoView: The time between page load progress start (0) and completion (100) in ms.

GV_PAGE_LOAD_MS.description: GeckoView: Time taken to load a page in ms. This includes all static contents, no dynamic content. Loading of about: pages is not counted.

GV_PAGE_RELOAD_MS.description: GeckoView: Time taken to reload a page in ms. This includes all static contents, no dynamic content. Loading of about: pages is not counted.

GV_STARTUP_RUNTIME_MS.description: GeckoView: Time taken to initialize GeckoRuntime in ms.

GV_STARTUP_MODULES_MS.description: GeckoView: Time taken to initialize all GeckoView modules in ms.

SCROLL_ANCHOR_ADJUSTMENT_LENGTH.description: The absolute length in CSS pixels of all scroll adjustments performed by scroll anchoring in a top-level document.

SCROLL_ANCHOR_ADJUSTMENT_COUNT.description: The amount of scroll adjustments performed by scroll anchoring in a top-level document.

QM_INIT_TELEMETRY_ERROR.description: Getting the number of errors in QuotaManager initialization.

HTTP_TRAFFIC_ANALYSIS_3.description: Numbers of HTTP transactions and connections by type. There are some categories separated by labels based on 5 parameters: 1. normal browsing or private browsing 2. system principal or not 3. first party or third party 4. class of service (Leader/Background/Others) 5. tracking classification (Basic/Content/FingerprintingContent).

THREAD_WAKEUP.description: How many milliseconds it took before 100 wakeups for the thread was done because of new Runnables.

REFRESH_DRIVER_TICK_PHASE_WEIGHT.description: Percentages of times for phases in an expensive refresh tick relative to the time spent in the entire tick (REFRESH_DRIVER_TICK).

PRESSHELL_REQS_PER_STYLE_FLUSH.description: The number of style flush requests pending per style flush.

PRESSHELL_REQS_PER_LAYOUT_FLUSH.description: The number of style flush requests and layout flush requests pending per layout flush. Both values are recorded because flushing a pending layout flush also flushes style.

PRESSHELL_FLUSHES_PER_TICK.description: The number of style and layout flushes that occur per Refresh Driver tick.

IDB_CUSTOM_OPEN_WITH_OPTIONS_COUNT.description: Tracking the use of the custom IDBFactory.open overload accepting an options dictionary in one of the categories.

SHARED_MEMORY_UA_SHEETS_MAPPED_PARENT.description: Whether the parent process successfully mapped the User Agent style sheet shared memory buffer at the desired address

SHARED_MEMORY_UA_SHEETS_MAPPED_PARENT_AF.description: Whether the parent process successfully re-mapped the User Agent style sheet shared memory buffer at the desired address after freezing it

SHARED_MEMORY_UA_SHEETS_MAPPED_CHILD.description: Whether a child process successfully mapped the User Agent style sheet shared memory buffer at the desired address

TLS_DELEGATED_CREDENTIALS_TIME_UNTIL_REA.description: milliseconds to complete a TLS handshake that used delegated credentials

PRESSHELL_LAYOUT_TOTAL_MS_PER_TICK.description: Time in milliseconds spent in the layout system per Refresh Driver tick.

SESSION_RESUMPTION_WITH_INTERNAL_CACHE_T.description: milliseconds to complete a TLS session resumption with internal cache

SESSION_RESUMPTION_WITH_EXTERNAL_CACHE_T.description: milliseconds to complete a TLS session resumption with external cache

WINDOW_OPEN_OUTER_SIZE.description: Flag indicating consumer of non-standard outerWidth/outerHeight features in window.open

WINDOW_REMOTE_SUBFRAMES_ENABLED_STATUS.description: Fission enabled status of individual windows in fission.autostart and non-fission.autostart profiles

BASE_FONT_FAMILIES_PER_PAGE.description: Number of font-family names used that resolved to base system fonts

LANGPACK_FONT_FAMILIES_PER_PAGE.description: Number of font-family names used that resolved to langpack-installed fonts

USER_FONT_FAMILIES_PER_PAGE.description: Number of font-family names used that resolved to user-installed fonts

WEB_FONT_FAMILIES_PER_PAGE.description: Number of font-family names used that resolved to web fonts

FALLBACK_TO_PREFS_FONT.description: Font fallback occurred using a font family specified in prefs

FALLBACK_TO_BASE_FONT.description: Font fallback occurred using a base system font

FALLBACK_TO_LANGPACK_FONT.description: Font fallback occurred using a langpack-installed font

FALLBACK_TO_USER_FONT.description: Font fallback occurred using a user-installed font

MISSING_FONT.description: Encountered a missing character (not supported by any available font)

MISSING_FONT_LANGPACK.description: Encountered a missing character that would have been supported by a langpack-installed font

MISSING_FONT_USER.description: Encountered a missing character that would have been supported by a user-installed font
